title: selnomeria
author: selnomeria
content: did he ever had an account here?or craig w?

comments.author: Little Mouse
comments.body: None of them have a profile here, at least no public profile. There are a lot of talk about Len Sassaman but I found no links to a bitcointalk profile. The same goes for Craig too. Ah wait, Craig is satoshi. So he has lol.Don't take it seriously. Craig can never prove himself as satoshi because he isn't satoshi

comments.author: YOSHIE
comments.body: Quote from: selnomeria on September 04, 2022, 05:05:14 PMdid he ever had an account here?or craig w?There is an account named: @Craig & @Sassaman.1. https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?action=profile;u=12752]Craig2. https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?action=profile;u=3337234]SassamanBut I don't know for sure, the account you are looking for is really them or not, what is clear is that there is an account with the same name on this forum.If we can find out, for what you want to know about the account.

comments.author: hosemary
comments.body: Quote from: YOSHIE on September 04, 2022, 06:55:58 PM2. https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?action=profile;u=3337234]SassamanThat account can't be owned by Sassaman.According to Wikipedia, Len Sassaman died in 2011. That account has been created in 2021.

comments.author: JeromeTash
comments.body: It doesn't matter if he had a profile here or not. I mean, you can never know, he could have used a different username here or never actually registered in this forum. As for Craig Wright, is that shithead worth any discussion here?

comments.author: BitcoinGirl.Club
comments.body: Quote from: YOSHIE on September 04, 2022, 06:55:58 PM1. https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?action=profile;u=12752]CraigInteresting. It seems the guy really had some mining interest and was working on a project in the domain bitcoinpays.com. Everything is clear that at some point he got into greed and started thinking ways to fake himself satoshi ðŸ¤£Where is bitcoin SV? LOLQuote from: selnomeria on September 04, 2022, 05:05:14 PMdid he ever had an account here?or craig w?Why don't you reach out to Faketoshi personally and ask nicely?

comments.author: aysg76
comments.body: Quote from: selnomeria on September 04, 2022, 05:05:14 PMdid he ever had an account here?or craig w?As per BPIP.org there are 50 accounts with username @Craig and they all might be setup for propaganda to help faketoshi with bullshit explanations.But why are we interested in these matters? Quote from: JeromeTash on September 04, 2022, 08:03:56 PMIt doesn't matter if he had a profile here or not. I mean, you can never know, he could have used a different username here or never actually registered in this forum. As for Craig Wright, is that shithead worth any discussion here?Yes they can have an account with any username on the forum but they can't prove anything because we all know why and faketohsi will soon end up very bad.

comments.author: LTU_btc
comments.body: I must admit that I had to Google who is he... Anyway, from public information that we have, we can't verify whether he had account or no. He didn't had account connected to his name, like some Bitcoin developpers. But nobody can't know whether he had account with other username.Don't know why, but I was sure that he had account here. But actually, same things like about Sassam can be said about Faketoshi. But you can try to contact Dr. Wright and ask him about Bitcointalk account .

comments.author: kaggie
comments.body: Probably not, considering Len said, "This big Bitcoin heist shows Bitcoin suffers from the worst of both worlds: no strong anonymity, yet no fraud reversal protection."https://mobile.twitter.com/lensassaman/status/81084436518674433"Big Bitcoin Heist" is a strong phrase against Bitcoin.Len Sassaman is considered a candidate for being Satoshi. He has an obituary embedded into the blockchain."During Bitcoinâ€™s development in 2008â€“2010, Len was increasingly active in financial cryptography. He joined The International Financial Cryptography Association and presented at the Financial Cryptography and Data conferences, where he also held a committee seat." His Belgian location though suggests he is not Satoshi.https://evanhatch.medium.com/len-sassaman-and-satoshi-e483c85c2b10
